Academic Publications on Watermarking and Instruction Tuning in Machine Learning

Yingqian Cui, Jie Ren, Yuping Lin, Han Xu, Pengfei He, Yue Xing, Lingjuan Lyu, Wenqi Fan, Hui Liu, and Jiliang Tang published a paper titled "FT-Shield: A Watermark Against Unauthorized Fine-Tuning in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models" in 2023.
Pierre Fernandez, Guillaume Couairon, Hervé Jégou, Matthijs Douze, and Teddy Furon published a paper titled "The Stable Signature: Rooting Watermarks in Latent Diffusion Models" in the IEEE/CVF International Conference on Computer Vision in 2023.
Liangqi Lei, Keke Gai, Jing Yu, and Liehuang Zhu published a paper titled "DiffuseTrace: A Transparent and Flexible Watermarking Scheme for Latent Diffusion Model" in 2024.
Cheng Xiong, Chuan Qin, Guorui Feng, and Xinpeng Zhang published a paper titled "Flexible and Secure Watermarking for Latent Diffusion Model" in the ACM International Conference on Multimedia in 2023.
Zhen Tan and colleagues published a survey on "Large Language Models for Data Annotation and Synthesis" in the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing in 2024.
